name: QuantSpark
description:
QuantSpark is an innovative boutique strategic analytics consultancy based in London. 
Our hybrid team combines the best of strategy consulting, data analytics and product development to deliver creative and impactful solutions to public and private sector clients. We go beyond the remit of traditional strategy consultancies by deploying advanced data analytics and software engineering capabilities to build bespoke tools that deliver long-lasting value – the tools and solutions we create become embedded in our clients’ daily operations. Our ever-growing client base consists of FTSE 100 retailers, prestigious Private Equity houses and governments.

team.title: CEO and Founder
team.name: Adam Hadley
team.bioHtml: Pioneering applied data science to solve strategic problems for business and government.

team.title: Senior Analyst (Data Science)
team.name: Olatunji Ogunbiyi
team.bioHtml: Data scientist with a track record of high quality work. Working knowledge of machine learning techniques. MSc Cognitive Science and BSc Physics graduate.

team.title: Engagement Manager
team.name: Ben Rogers
team.bioHtml: Leading a team of Data Scientists and Analysts, I deliver transformational strategic analytics projects for retail and private equity clients.

perks.title: 25 days annual leave and Bank holidays

jobs.title: Analyst - Business Intelligence
jobs.description:
QuantSpark is a strategic analytics and innovation consultancy focussed on supporting large retailers and private equity funds. We apply commercial creativity and analytical rigour to tackle our clients' trickiest problems by combining strategic commercial acumen with the power of data science and bespoke product development.


As a BI Analyst at QuantSpark, you will be joining a team of driven, entrepreneurial, and intellectually-curious analysts who are laser-focused on providing commercial impact. We're a small but super-effective team so in particular we look out for Analysts who have entrepreneurial flair, attention to detail and an ability to understand what's important for our clients to succeed.


We are looking for a BI Analyst to join our Private Equity practice and work with a diverse range of portfolio companies to build out their data analytics capability. You will gain exposure to a vast range of different businesses and sectors – recent clients include The Foundry (responsible for the software behind almost all Special Effects Oscar winning movies!), IRIS (a billion-pound SaaS business) and Aqua Lung (the inventor and now world leading manufacturer of Scuba Diving apparatus).


As a BI Analyst you will help deliver BI projects end-to-end, from data extraction, engineering and modelling through to visualisation, regular reporting, and dashboard creation. Solutions vary from developing custom-built BI tools to leveraging existing products in the market such as PowerBI, Tableau, and Alteryx. We like to involve our Analysts as much as possible, so expect to meet and get to know senior client stakeholders during the projects (both from the portfolio company and the PE fund). The outputs of our BI projects typically have two highly impactful outputs; 1) as a source of day-to-day insight for senior management to guide the company’s performance, and 2) for the PE find to share with investors as an ‘interactive pitch-book’ during the investment exit process.


We welcome applications from anyone with a flair for super-powering decisions with data and an ambition to have practical impact. We're looking for people with a creative and robust approach to data engineering, data visualisation and problem solving.

Requirements

So who are we looking for? You will have a range of analytical, commercial, and inter-personal qualities including:

- Analytical ability - understanding data and transforming this into insight
- Technical creativity - many of the solutions our clients require intellectual dexterity
- Grit - some of our work is tough and requires a can-do attitude
- Desire to learn - our work is innovative and so our team needs to sustain its sense of curiosity and desire to master new techniques
- Communication - we require articulate individuals who are able to understand complex information and distil this for non-technical audiences


Essential:

- Advanced skills in SQL

- Advanced skills in both PowerBI and Tableau

- Experience with database structures and engineering

- Understanding of SQL technologies such as: MySQL / MariaDB, Hive / Impala SQL, SparkSQL, NoSQL, Postgres SQL Server

- Strong MS Excel skills, with VBA being a plus

- Experience with Alteryx


Desirable:

- Interest in potentially applying R and Python

- Experience of product development and desire to learn more

- Experience in strategy consultancy or in an in-house strategy position

- GIS technologies including: QGIS, ArcGIS, Google Maps APIs

- Agile experience, product design, product management

- Understanding of machine learning approaches

Benefits

* £30-45k salary (based on experience)
* Monthly training & conference budget
* 25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
* Pension contribution scheme
* Cycle to work scheme
* Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
* Top-notch kit with high-end Macs standard for everyone
* Monthly socials and dinner


Location: Farringdon, London (though you may have to work at clients' offices from time to time including outside of the UK)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Developer - Data Engineer
jobs.description:
QuantSpark helps businesses by blending commercial strategy, data modelling and software development to support smarter decisions. We use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.


Our teams excel because we are interdisciplinary, creative and focused on providing social and commercial impact. Our work spans both the private and public sector, with clients including the United Nations, FTSE100 companies, high street retailers and Private Equity portfolio companies.


Our recent projects include
- analysing 1bn+ of transactions to help a supermarket decide how to allocate their store space
- developing terrorist content algorithms to enable internet platforms to tackle terrorist propaganda
- creating a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns


What the role is about

As a Data Engineer at QuantSpark, you will work in a client or product squad. You will be able to switch between squads on a regular basis, thus experiencing many opportunities to have an impact on a range of projects.

Whichever squad you work with, you will identify and use data sets, perform data analysis and research, and create working models and tools that can be used by our clients. You will take ownership of this from conception all the way to validation.

Our squads are small and nimble, so you will have plenty of opportunities to bring in your own expertise and introduce your preferred best practices.

Requirements

The key qualities we are looking for are Analytical ability, Technical creativity, Grit, a Desire to learn and clear Communications.

We welcome applications from any educational background and level of experience. We don't expect you to be brilliant at everything, but we value a broad set of competencies as much as experience, so any interest in people management, data science, strategy or product management would be appreciated as well.


You should have the following technical skills:
- Data analysis (using Python, possibly Neptune)
- Data processing (BigQuery, Hadoop, Spark, EMR, Kinesis)
- Data storage and caching (eg Sql, MongoDB, Redis)
- Unit testing, TDD
- Linux / Bash
- Code management (Git, Bitbucket)


As a bonus, you would also have the following experience:
AWS technologies (eg Lambda, RDS, SQS, S3, EC2)
Software architecture
Advanced code deployment (CI, CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

- £45k - £70k salary (based on experience)
- Annual training & conference budget
- Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
- 25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
- Pension contribution scheme
- Cycle to work scheme

Our office is at Farringdon, London although you may have to work at clients' offices from time to time including outside of the UK.

jobs.title: Developer - Full stack
jobs.description:
QuantSpark helps businesses by blending commercial strategy, data modelling and software development to support smarter decisions. We use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

Our teams excel because we are interdisciplinary, creative and focused on providing social and commercial impact. Our work spans both the private and public sector, with clients including the United Nations, FTSE100 companies, high street retailers and Private Equity portfolio companies.

Our recent projects include

● analysing 1bn+ of transactions to help a supermarket decide how to allocate their store space

● developing terrorist content algorithms to enable internet platforms to tackle terrorist propaganda

● creating a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns


What the role is about

As a Full Stack Developer at QuantSpark, you will work in a client or product squad. You will be able to switch between squads on a regular basis, thus experiencing many opportunities to have an impact on a range of projects.

Whichever squad you work with, you will develop client-facing functionality, such as websites and web applications, from detailing requirements, designing and developing a solution to testing and validating that the solution does match user expectations. You will work both on the backend (eg API endpoints) and frontend (eg JavaScript/HTML) of features.

Our squads are small and nimble, so you will have plenty of opportunities to bring in your own expertise and introduce your preferred best practices.

Requirements

The key qualities we are looking for are Analytical ability, Technical creativity, Grit, a Desire to learn and clear Communications

We welcome applications from any educational background and level of experience. We don't expect you to be brilliant at everything, but we value a broad set of competencies as much as experience, so any interest in people management, data science, strategy or product management would be appreciated as well.

You should have the following technical skills:

- Javascript full-stack development (Node, NPM, Nginx, React, Webpack, HTML, CSS)

- Python development (Flask, Gunicorn)

- Data storage and caching (eg Sql, MongoDB, Redis)

- Unit testing, TDD

- Linux / Bash

- Code management (Git, Bitbucket)

As a bonus, you would also have the following:

- A keen eye for good user interface design and user experience

- Experience of designing a web app architecture

- Knowledge of advanced code deployment (CI, CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

Light and airy office space

Pension scheme

Cycle to work scheme

25 days holiday ( plus bank holiday)

Various discounts including on gyms and cinema tickets

jobs.title: Developer - Python Engineer
jobs.description:
At QuantSpark we combine commercial strategy, data modelling and software development to help our clients make smarter decisions. Our small teams of developers and consultants use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

We do work for high street retailers, FTSE firms, Private Equity companies - and also do pro-bono work for the United Nations, amongst others, through the QuantSpark Foundation.

What the role is about

As a Python Developer at QuantSpark, you will build the backend of websites and applications that our clients use to better understand the data and models we have assembled for them. This means getting to the bottom of what is needed, designing and developing a good solution, and testing and validating that it works as expected.

QuantSpark being a small and smart company, you will be able to bring in your own expertise and ways of doing things, as well as learning a tremendous amount as part of your work, from colleagues and via training. You will also be able to switch between teams and thus work on a range of projects, including pro-bono ones.

Over time, you could become a Full Stack developer, or learn about Data Analysis and become a Data Engineer, as well as expand your knowledge of DevOps and Automated Testing - if that’s where you want to take your career.

Requirements

We don’t look for specific academic achievements or levels of experience. Instead we welcome applicants who can show technical ability, creativity, good communications, grit and a desire to learn.

More specifically for this role, you will need the following skills:

- Python development (Flask, Gunicorn)

- Data storage and caching (eg Sql, MongoDB, Redis)

- Unit testing, TDD

- Linux / Bash

- Code management (Git, Bitbucket)

As a bonus, you would also have:

- Experience of designing a web app architecture

- Knowledge of advanced code deployment (CI, CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

- £40k to £60k base salary, based on your profile, plus bonuses

- Nice, comfortable, quiet office just outside Farringdon station

- Annual training & conference budget

- 33 days of holiday (including bank holidays)

- Pension contribution scheme

- Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: Front-end / UI Designer
jobs.description:
QuantSpark is pioneering the strategic application of data science through the development of complex decision-support software. Our small teams of developers and consultants use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

We do work for high street retailers, FTSE firms, Private Equity companies - and also do pro-bono work for the United Nations, amongst others, through the QuantSpark Foundation.

What the role is about

As a Frontend/UI Designer, you will build websites or applications that our clients use to better understand the data and models we have assembled for them. This means getting to the bottom of what is needed, designing and developing a good solution, and testing and validating that it works as expected.

QuantSpark being a small and smart company, you will be able to bring in your own expertise and ways of doing things, as well as learning a tremendous amount as part of your work, from colleagues and via training. You will also be able to switch between teams and thus work on a range of projects, including pro-bono ones.

You could eventually become a Frontend expert, learn more about automated testing or DevOps, move into Full-Stack development, or get started on Strategic Consulting if that’s where you want to take your career.

Requirements

We don’t look for specific academic achievements or levels of experience. Instead we welcome applicants who can show technical ability, creativity, good communications, grit and a desire to learn.

More specifically for this role, you will need the following skills:

- Javascript frontend development (React, Webpack, HTML, CSS)

- Unit testing, TDD

- Linux / Bash

- Code management (Git, Bitbucket)

As well as a keen eye for good user interface design and user experience.

As a bonus, you would also have:

- Experience of designing a web app architecture

- Knowledge of code deployment (CI, CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

- £40k to £60k base salary, based on your profile, plus bonuses

- Annual training & conference budget

- 33 days of holiday (including bank holidays)

- Pension contribution scheme

- Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: Open Source Intelligence Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
QuantSpark

This role is for an analyst to join QuantSpark’s Open Source Intelligence team. QuantSpark combines the best of strategy consultancy, data science, tool development, and industry expertise.

Together we deliver strategic level analysis and build mission-critical tools to support our customers making smarter decisions. Our hybrid approach to data-strategy means we combine understanding an organisation’s strategic objectives with our ability to build sophisticated tools and carry out meaningful analysis of large, complex here. More details on QuantSpark are available here: https://www.quantspark.com

Role

We are looking for an Analyst to work in our Open Source Intelligence collection team. The role will involve collecting and collating intelligence online and drafting analytical reports. You will be responsible for managing investigations via open source information for a variety of our clients including IGOs, the public and private sector.

Key responsibilities include:
• Ability to find open source information from a range of mainstream and niche social media sites;
• Drafting original analysis for customers in the public and private sector;
• Engaging with the business development team to refine the offering to clients;
• Working with data scientists and developers to help them automate basic collection and collation activities;
• Writing articles on the applications of open source data to solve real world problems.

The Person

Our ideal candidate will have be confident to draft reports detailing complex findings. You will have previous experience of online data collection and subsequent content analysis. You should also be able to demonstrate a good (non-technical) understanding of how the internet works and where/how to collect user generated content.

The following skills would be advantageous but are not essential:
• Familiarity with Linux, TweetDeck, Tableau/Microsoft PowerBI;
• Basic coding awareness (R, python, SQL etc);
• French, Russian, Arabic or Chinese language,
• Relevant work experience (eg in academia, government/military, risk consultancy, etc).

Education: The applicant should have either a relevant degree level qualification or equivalent work experience.

Career progression: The candidate has the potential to be managing a team of 2 to 3 with-in twelve months.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Analytics Platform
jobs.description:
QuantSpark helps businesses by blending commercial strategy, data modelling and software development to support smarter decisions. We use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

Our teams excel because we are interdisciplinary, creative and focused on providing social and commercial impact. Our work spans both the private and public sector, with clients including the United Nations, FTSE100 companies, high street retailers and Private Equity portfolio companies.

Our recent projects include:

analysing 1bn+ of transactions to help a supermarket decide how to allocate their store space

developing terrorist content algorithms to enable internet platforms to tackle terrorist propaganda

creating a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns

What the role is about

We are looking for a Product Manager to take ownership of the product direction of several projects. Whilst client-driven, the projects have a clear potential to lead to the creation of fully-fledged products. Your role will consist in understanding client needs, framing them into a clear direction that our teams can follow, and detailing the vision and shape of the new products, eventually seeing them throughout to their launch.

These products will cover a range of topics (including online content collection, analysis and data processing), as well as various industries (social media, web platforms, etc). As such you will be exposed to a wide set of challenges and will be working with several teams, and you will have plenty of opportunities to bring in your own expertise and introduce your preferred best practices. You will also work closely with, and report to, our Founder and MD.

Requirements

The key qualities we are looking for are Analytical ability, Technical creativity, Grit, a Desire to learn and clear Communications.

We welcome applications from any educational background. We don't expect you to be brilliant at everything, but we value a broad set of competencies, so any interest in data science or strategy would be appreciated as well.

You should have experience in the following:

Software product management (whole lifecycle, client-facing, multiple products)

Working with and supporting teams of software developers

Creative problem solving

Agile principles (eg Kanban, Scrum) and development tools (eg Jira, Trello)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

* Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
* £40-60k salary (based on experience)
* Monthly training & conference budget
* 25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
* Pension contribution scheme
* Cycle to work scheme
* Top-notch kit with high-end Macs standard for everyone
* Monthly socials and dinners
jobs.descriptionHtml:
QuantSpark helps businesses by blending commercial strategy, data modelling and software development to support smarter decisions. We use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

Our teams excel because we are interdisciplinary, creative and focused on providing social and commercial impact. Our work spans both the private and public sector, with clients including the United Nations, FTSE100 companies, high street retailers and Private Equity portfolio companies.

Our recent projects include:

analysing 1bn+ of transactions to help a supermarket decide how to allocate their store space

developing terrorist content algorithms to enable internet platforms to tackle terrorist propaganda

creating a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns

What the role is about

We are looking for a Product Manager to take ownership of the product direction of several projects. Whilst client-driven, the projects have a clear potential to lead to the creation of fully-fledged products. Your role will consist in understanding client needs, framing them into a clear direction that our teams can follow, and detailing the vision and shape of the new products, eventually seeing them throughout to their launch.

These products will cover a range of topics (including online content collection, analysis and data processing), as well as various industries (social media, web platforms, etc). As such you will be exposed to a wide set of challenges and will be working with several teams, and you will have plenty of opportunities to bring in your own expertise and introduce your preferred best practices. You will also work closely with, and report to, our Founder and MD.

Requirements

The key qualities we are looking for are Analytical ability, Technical creativity, Grit, a Desire to learn and clear Communications.

We welcome applications from any educational background. We don't expect you to be brilliant at everything, but we value a broad set of competencies, so any interest in data science or strategy would be appreciated as well.

You should have experience in the following:

Software product management (whole lifecycle, client-facing, multiple products)

Working with and supporting teams of software developers

Creative problem solving

Agile principles (eg Kanban, Scrum) and development tools (eg Jira, Trello)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

  • Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
  • £40-60k salary (based on experience)
  • Monthly training & conference budget
  • 25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
  • Pension contribution scheme
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Top-notch kit with high-end Macs standard for everyone
  • Monthly socials and dinners
